Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Maanyao
Reviews.Content: Our family had a very pleasant stay in condotti hotel.the reception was very helpful and the location , magnificent! Will definitely stay in condotti on our next visit to rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: CocoM8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than we expected the location was excellent all the sights were easily reachable. The room was spotless and had everything that you could want and the staff were very helpful. Thank you to the staff for a fantastic trip we hope to return soon and wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Condotti.

Reviews.Title: “family holiday march 2012”
Reviews.Author: guy b
Reviews.Content: Brilliant! We had a family room in the annexe. ( you get your own front door key - fantastic) 2 excellent beds, a very nice bathroom. Nicely decorated, clean, comfortable. The staff were excellent, friendly and very helpful. Location is fantastic, next to the Spanish steps, plenty of places to eat, and shop! It will be at the top of our list when we return to this lovely hotel and superb city!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great room, good service”
Reviews.Author: TresMusketeers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights - just right. Great location within walking distance of Spagna underground station and Spanish Steps. We walked to Trevi Fountain at night too, well lit and felt very safe (with child) - only about 10-15 mins away. You have to book in at Reception at the Condotti Hotel which is around the corner (literally 1 min and not an issue). Our room (318) had the neighbouring room's bathroom built into it, so we heard flushing, showers etc easily through the thin walls. The floors were tiled rather than carpeted, so we heard the people up above too. They do provide lovely Condotti slippers so perhaps that is a hint for people to use them instead of their noisy shoes! People were also very noisy in the hall when arriving and leaving. We used earplugs on the 2nd and 3rd nights! We did request a top floor room (4th floor) but they were booked. It was a good size family room with large modern bathroom. Very nice. Beds were a little too hard for our liking. Double glazed window with shutters overlooking the street. Noise from outside was not a problem. Receptionists were very helpful - we were really impressed with them all. One evening we were treated to a complimentary drink and snacks in the reception area. Free use of internet on a computer in the foyer. Did not try the 10 Euro breakfast. Instead we went to the local supermarket which was 10 mins walk away and got really nice bread, cheese, yogurt, etc for A LOT less. Water is also drinkable in Rome but there are no tea making facilities in the room. We got a taxi from the taxi stand at FCO Airport for 40 Euros which was perfect, rather than paying the 60 Euros quoted by the hotel. Would stay again if the rate was better and would insist on 4th floor room or would try Condotti Hotel(?)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gal B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and we actually didn't expect to have such a great hotel in this low price. The hotel is completly worth the money and even more than that. The staff was very kind and helpful!!! they helped us in everithing we needed. The room was perfectly clean,we had a huge bed and even a balcony (i guess we were lucky to have this room). The hotel location is unbelieveable. It is located exactly 1 minute of walk from the famous spanish steps and from the main shopping street "via del corso", all the main sites of rome are within a walking distance. We really enjoyed staying there. Condotti palace was a great choice! till our next visit in rome, Arrivederci

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: skiathosjsi
Reviews.Content: We booked through the internet, primarily because of its location and we were right!! The location was ideal, all within a short walking distance (metro, sights, Piazza di Spagna, Villa Borghese, Colosseum, etc). The hotel itself? Just two words: great choice. The room was really nice, top floor, small terrace, nice bathroom. Definite value for money choice. Only one suggestion; the hotel choice was largely influenced by the location and the availability of WI-FI internet; Two out of the 3 nights, the connection kept shutting down due to overload in capacity. The hotel should try to improve on this, to make it easier for guests to make use of this great feature. All in all, Condotti Palace is a great hotel to stay at, while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: LOTTYW
Reviews.Content: Ideal location...near the station and everything is within walking distance. The only problem we experienced with the Condotti was that we would have liked tea/coffee making facilities with it was an aparthotel as oppossed to a hotel...would advise to take a travel kettle if you would like a cuppa first thing!! We ordered room service for 2 orange juices and 2 cups of tea on our first morning and it cost 20 euros!!!

Reviews.Title: “It is good to stay”
Reviews.Author: costas c
Reviews.Content: excellent location,worth for value,excellenet receptionists

Reviews.Title: “The best location ever !”
Reviews.Author: Amir-Marcopolo
Reviews.Content: in heart of Rome -Spanish steps u can reach everywhere by walking. clean & cosy . frindly staff. Definitly I come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Quality-Price-Location”
Reviews.Author: Arturo Z
Reviews.Content: This little brother of the Condotti Hotel, just around the corner, is perfect if you are looking for a great location (just 2 blocks form the Spanish Steps and via Condotti). Newly reforms the rooms are simple & well decorated, in terms of quality-price and location I don't think it can get any better.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Superb accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: ShaikhChilli
Reviews.Content: For the price (280 euros for three nights - Expedia), this hotel can't be beat. Its a 30 second walk from the Spanish Steps and in a very nice (and very chic) part of Rome. Innumerable restaurants at your doorstep (quite literally) and small narrow cobblestone streets make the location quaint and fun to explore. Lots of shops (the usual Mango, Prada, etc.). as well as a nearby Carrefour supermarket and a pharmacy (farmacia) within a block or so. The hotel's reception is located around the corner, but its actually much closer than it sounds (30 seconds walk). We literally felt as if we were in the center of all the action. The Trevi Fountain is a 15-20 minute walk in one direction and the Populo Piazza is another 15 minute walk in the opposite direction. The Spagna metro station is a five minute walk from the hotel. We had a double room which, though a bit on the small side, was comfortable, clean and contemporary. A little balcony overlooked a courtyard (we were on the third floor) and a flat screen TV gave the room a newish look. The bathroom was also a bit on the small side but more than made up for it with contemporary furnishings. The bed was quite comfortable and the room was cleaned very well every day during our stay (three nights). The hotel has free Internet, although we were only able to connect at one particular spot in our room (which seems par for the course in most hotels in Rome anyway). There is also a free Internet station in the reception area. Breakfast is available at 10 euros per person every day, but given the hotel's proximity to so many restaurants, we went out to eat for every meal. The folks at the reception were very helpful and friendly and it was a pleasure dealing with them. They were the epitome of professionalism and enhanced the cheerful atmosphere. This is quite a romantic hotel and has a cosy yet contemporary feel about it. We traveled during off-peak season (November) and got an excellent rate through Expedia (particularly given that most hotels in this area go for about 300-500 euros per night). When we checked in. a porter carried our bags and showed us to our room. On checking out, we asked for a cab to the airport and had one waiting outside the hotel less than three minutes after our request. Not bad for 7 AM on a Sunday morning! Overall. a very nice place to stay. We would definitely recommend the place. The price was a bargain given the excellent quality of accommodation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: kjellkri
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the Palace. It is a block from the Spanish stairs and just where the shopping area begins. So location is perfect. Forum, Coliseum, The Vatican, Fontana di Trevi, and many other sights are within walking distance (<30 min). The room we had was not big but ample. We liked the provided safe and access to Wi-Fi. The room had a nice standard and was spotlessly clean. The tiles on the floor were impressive. There was also a good air conditioning. The beds are on the hard side, which I like. My SO would have preferred them a bit softer. The stairs in the Palace are a bit steep. But there is a lift - but we never used it. The luggage was carried to and from the room by the staff. When we checked out we just left the luggage in the room. And in the evening we came back and collected it in time for our late afternoon flight. The breakfast room is around the corner, in the basement of the hotel. It is really tiny and can be crowded. There is not a huge buffet; there is no room for it. But we have no complaint about the available food. The staff is extremely kind and helpful. And their English is probably better than mine. The only problem we had was with the sound insulation. The hard tiled floors caused a lot of noise when people rolled their luggage in the room upstairs. It woke us up. The same when the restaurants carried out their empty bottles. But booth things happened when we should wake up anyhow. It is a really nice hotel with a great location. I most likely will go back the next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: derlich70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Condotti hotel following our friend’s recommendation (they already stayed in the hotel several times). When I bought my house, my real estate agent told me that there are 3 important things to consider: “location, location and location” – this is true also when selecting hotels and Condotti hotel is located in an outstanding location – it is about 2 minutes walking from Spanish Steps and Piazza di Spagna - it means that you are in the center of everything. Since I'm a Platinum member in Priority Club (Inter Continental, Holiday Inn, etc.) I usually stays in IHG hotels, but I couldn't find any good location in Rome - except for Inter Continental which was 3 times more expensive than what we paid, so I decided to book a room in Condotti hotel. I stayed in the hotel with my wife between Nov 3rd to Nov 8th and even though the Spagna metro station is located just 2 minutes from the hotel, we only used it once, neither had to take a taxi. The only time we used the metro was when we went to the Vatican. In the rest of our vacation, we just traveled in the streets and there is no better way to see Rome than by walking in the streets. Since you are in the middle of everything, you just go out and walk. There are also many restaurants in the area and everyone will be able to find a place to eat in his budget (from 5 Euro to 50 Euro per person). We booked a standard room, but were upgraded for free to a junior suite which was great. Cons: The only complaint that I have is that the hotel balcony was allocated on top of our room and at least once I woke in the middle of the night, due to noise from the wood ceiling, since someone was walking there for 10 minutes (probably smoking).

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Location, Fair Price, Hard Beds, A Little Noisy”
Reviews.Author: NorthShoreLkSup
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a location that allows you to walk to every major attraction, if you wish. Staff were welcoming and helpful. **One note, the Via della Croce address is for some rooms, while the lobby is around the corner on Mario del Fiore - need to check-in at the lobby. Rooms were super clean, well-appointed, small but absolutely fine for size, nice 4th floor lounge that opened to a courtyard. I don't mind stiff beds, but these were pretty hard. Not bad for a few nights but wouldn't stay for more than 3 nights. It was above average temps when we stayed and the hotel had switched to 'heating only.' While we had the setting at its lowest and fans off, the room was hot, much too hot to sleep in without the windows open. So sleeping was tough with the street noises [people, vehicles, garbage removal, etc]. FYI - the hotel will set up airport taxi service for 60 euro for 2 with luggage, but you can make your own arrangements for 40 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Staff excellent - room small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: JoCoMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Other reports will tell you about the location so I won't bother. It is in an expensive tourist area so don't expect any shopping or restaurant bargains nearby. We stayed around the corner and whilst the room was clean we thought it was a bit pokey with not much natural light. The major disappointment was the noise level between rooms. Plumbing noise was particularly bad. The staff were great - extremely helpful. It is not a big hotel so do not expect bars or other big hotel facilities. Room size and internal noise were big negatives to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great feed back on my questions.”
Reviews.Author: nuijohn
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Condotti in the past. This trip, as in the past, I was extremely impresssed at how fast my emails were replied to...within one day. We were on a cruise so time was very important. Condotti arranged a cab from airport to hotel; then next day a cabs to port. Both were paid in advance, both cabs were exactly on time and drove us to destination perfectly. The hotel location is front and center and walking distance to many interesting sites. Our room clean, comfortable; and secure. There is a great restaurant in hotel and plenty of restaurants close. Spanish steps is arround the corner. Cabs are available for longer trips...i.e. Bacilica. Next trip to Rome...we will stay at Palace Condotti. Aloha, John./Nancy

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Luis S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. Staff was helpful and friendly. We stayed at the annex which is around the corner. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The location is excellent. Close to the Spanish Steps and the metro. Many dining options around. Within walking distance to many of the main sites. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, the staff were very helpful, the rooms were very clean and we even got a room upgrade on our arrival. Definately be back, and recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 nighsts in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sukanitt J
Reviews.Content: Free wi-fi in your room (sometimes, it was too slow). Staff is just so-so but the woman with short blond hair is very nice and helpfule. The location is great just few steps from the Spagna steps and the metro. There are nice restaurants around the hotel area as well. The hotel is clean, decoration is nice, facial tissue paper was provided!!No doorman for Condotti Palace but the hotel staff surveillance from Condotti Hotel 24 hours(I guess!).

Reviews.Title: “Great,great,great”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1988
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just awesome. This is definitely the hotel to stay for all shopoholics! Of cause if you like to be in the center of all action, this is it too! Staff are fantastic,rooms are exceptionally clean,bed is comfortable. So much more... Also while you are there, try the restuarant 34, just next to the hotel's lobby. The staff recommended us there after our arrival,and we went back every single meal for our 5 days stay in Rome! Definitely going back and recommended to all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VickiChase
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was in the perfect area. Paula was the host and was very pleasant and very helpful - Canadian, so we had someone to speak english with. Rooms and bathroom were clean and our room was quite. Love the small terrace that was with the room, but could not use it because it was just too darn hot out but very cute.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GaryLex
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartments just around the corner from the hotel. There was enough room for the four of us (2 adults, 2 kids) and every thing was clean. The staff on the reception were very nice. The only disappointments were a leaky airconditioner that didn't get attended to over 5 days despite our repeated requests, a leak in the bathroom resulting is apool of water in one corner, and some noisy fellow guests above who took joy in stomping aronud each night when they came in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hosts, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jjhuckleberry
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at the Condotti Palace you are greated by hosts that speak perfect english , italian, spanish, german and who knows what else , I heard it all. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The hotel is located 2 blocks from the spanish steps in the best shopping area of Rome. I would definitel;y go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue B
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family to Rome in August and wanted something nice near the centre. All of us loved the Condotti. The service from being picked up at the airport, to arriving at the hotel and everything after that was fabulous and the location perfect. As someone who travels with business a lot, the intimacy of the Condotti was a lovely change and I can honestly say that the whole experience could not have been more positive. On a final note - in terms of value for money I cannot imagine a better option than the Hotel Cndotti - amazing for such a central spot! We loved our trip and we will be back - Thank You Allx

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rome, great service and fantastic restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Andrew206
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable, a great location for sightseeing. Requested restaurant recommendations each night and received 3 great ones, don't be afraid to ask the concierges they are very good

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Joy P
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a quadruple room for 3 nights in June 2011 with my family of 4. For a three star hotel the room was kept very clean and had high ceilings that made the room look spacious for a family of 4. Whilst my children slept on a sofa bed they didn't complain as we were hardly in the room. The hotel is in a great location, central to everything, Spanish Steps and shopping yet it is still very quiet at night. Just remember to check into Condotti Hotel first, which is just around the corner, as you will not be able to enter Condotti Palace without a key.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: juliec303
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for our family of five. I loved the location- tons of shopping, cafes, a pharmacy, supermarket.....and of course, the Spanish Steps all within a few minuts walk. The rooms were spacious and very clean, and Paula at the desk was so kind and helpful to us. We will definitely be returning on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rome”
Reviews.Author: emckell
Reviews.Content: This was a great pick for us. The location was great, right in shoppers paradise and central to the sites. The service was excellent and the room clean and tidy. Thanks Condotti.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, great for families”
Reviews.Author: Conanzonan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Condotti Palace for 2 nights, it's great value and the rooms are modern, comfortable and clean. The staff are all really helpful and Angelo in particularly is an assett. Would recommend for families looking for good value, good location, solid base to visit Rome. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: GG-AA-RR-YY
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in this hotel over the course of the week that we were in Rome. The hotel rooms are very good. Extremely well maintained. The location is fantastic. Close to the Spanish Steps, Close to great restaurants, Close to the main shopping district. Yet far enough away so that any noise pollution will not disturb your trip, plus there are sound-proof windows to provide added tranquility. But the major plus point would have to be the marvellous staff. From the cleaners to the reception area, each and every one of them made us feel wanted, relaxed and added so much enjoyment to our trip. No awkward rules and regulations, their rule book centers around the resident. So whatever they can do to make you happy they will do their utmost to make it happen. Best hotel I have stayed at, home or abroad.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: rdmmom
Reviews.Content: We loved the location - two minute walk from the Spanish Steps ans ten minutes from the Pantheon. Shopping all around. The rooms are small but adequate and very clean. The breakfast is fine - fruit, yogurt, pastry, cold cuts, cheese, rolls, juice and coffee. The concierge gave us dining advice and even told us where to go for the best gelato in the neighborhood! All the staff were extremely helpful and kind. The hotel arranged transportation from the airport and a tour of the city - a little expensive, but well done. We look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected - typically Italian”
Reviews.Author: amsam
Reviews.Content: Condotti Palace hotel is well located, very clean with very friendly and with helpful staff. The hotel is a bit hap hazard in design, that said it is in the old part of the city and the building has been adapted into a hotel. We booked a family room for four people, the main room was fine but the kids room was basically a wide part of the hallway that had a lounge with a mattress placed on top and a trundle bed that when pulled out made it impossible to pass. We were fortunate to have two toilets in the room which made getting ready in the mornings a lot easier. We were not disappointed rather it was not what we expected and differed to what the hotel portrays on its web site, that said it satisfied our need for this trip and cleanliness is important to us and this is a very clean establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the price”
Reviews.Author: ianjamesmac
Reviews.Content: The main bonus of this hotel is location and staff. The location is absolutely perfect, just feet from Spanish steps and in a quaint network of cobbled streets with beautiful restaurants and cafes. Unbeatable. The staff are great, romolo on front desk in particular is a real asset. Rooms are clean and well maintained. They had some work being down whilst we were there which is never ideal but didn't bother us really. Only one down point, We ordered breakfast in bed one morning and it was abysmal - but to condotti's total credit they didn't charge us for it when we complained. I have visited Rome six times in the past year as I've been planning my wedding over there, and this hotel has to be the best value for money. Not to repeat myself but location, location location is why this hotel is such great value for money. That and the good customer Service. Oh, and FREE wifi!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: GibraltarChatterbox
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Spanish Steps and walking distance to the Trevi Fountain. The Metro station Spagna is 3 minutes walk and there are numerous buses. Also plenty of restaurants and ice cream bars all within a few steps of the door.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: clomb
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very welcoming and helpful. Condotti Palace around the corned from Condotti Hotel and staff were eager to help show our accommodation and help with carrying luggage. Rooms were good size for centre of Rome. The double glazing was fantastic as it was a Sunday morning and with windows closed you could not hear the bells ringing!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Natalia_a_d
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great! The hotel was in a perfect location, right down the street from the Spanish Steps. We were close to some really great restaurants and shops. The staff was very helpful and answered all our questions. We stayed in the annex, and the rooms were very neat, and all the accomodations were perfect. I would recommend Condotti Palace to anyone visiting Rome who is looking for a great hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hammer89
Reviews.Content: Service staff was very courteous and helpful, spoke English well. Hotel is situated close to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and shopping on Via Del Corso. Good vaue for where it was located. Lots of restaurants located just outside hotel. Room was quiet at night despite being in a busy area. Great spot for couples.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location , charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: juanluisamoroso
Reviews.Content: close to the Spanish steps, taxi stand , Metro station , many restaurans & main shopping street in Rome ; room of average size ; breakfast room was small & in the basement ; staff was very agreeable ; they had to change us to another room & they sent a bottle of asti spumanti ;the first room faced an interior patio with a balcony; the other one faced the street ; my spouse liked the interior one; I preferred the other one since noise doesn't bother me , plus it died down by 10 or 11 ; and I like opening the window & seeing the people strolling & sitting in the outside cafes

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TooOldtosurf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family suite at the Condotti Plaza. Our room set up was not ideal for our needs but in the end it worked out okay. We booked a room that slept 4 people. What we received was a 1 bedroom with a king bed and a pull out couch, double bed size. Not what we expected. We were traveling with our teenage son and daughter so they weren't interested in sharing a bed. We were able to pull the king bed apart into 2 single beds, then my wife and I slept on the pull out couch/bed. The couch/bed was the most comfortable I'd ever slept on so in the end it was okay. The hotel is just around the corner from the Spanish Steps, the Spagna Metro stop and right in the middle of the Via Fiori shopping area. My wife and daughter loved shopping. The hotel is an easy walk to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navonna, Campo di Fiori and Piazza Poppollo. Couldn't ask for a better location. The air conditioning worked well so at the end of a sweaty tour it was nice to come back and crash. There are plenty of places to eat near the hotel. If you stay here, make sure you go to the rooftop lounge/garden. It is a great place to relax and give yourself some extra space. We used the car service between the airport and the hotel and found it to be a good value. The hotel staff was very friendly, helpful and spoke good english.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KANDE-NSB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condotti Palace on the recommendation of my sister and her husband and brother and his wife. They stayed there in June 2010 and really liked it. The service was very good at the hotel and the front desk was very helpful. The location was perfect - an easy walk to sightseeing, cafes, and the metro station. If we get a chance to go back to Rome, we'll definitely plan on staying at the Condotti again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mdepatie
Reviews.Content: We would like to mention the excellent service we had during our stay at the Condotti Hotel in Rome. The breakfast included was quite delightful, the bed was comfortable; the room was very clean and quiet. The Hotel, which is located nearby La Piazza Di Spagna, is in a central area where we could find the main attractions, boutiques and trattorias. We also would like to thank the personnel especially Paula and Vladimiro; you make our trip a rich and pleasant experience. M.Depatie

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: gocheto
Reviews.Content: The Condotti was in a good location to the Spanish Steps, the metro and the high scale stores. It is the first hotel we had ever been in where you checked in at one location and went down the block and around the corner to get to your room. It ended up being fine. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was quite dark even if the curtains were open,however it was very clean and comfortable for the amount of time we spent in it. We did think the breakfast that was available was overpriced but it was convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Dustycatbc
Reviews.Content: Location - perfect, just short block away from Spanish Steps, as well as the Metro station. Room - very neat and clean, with a spacious bathroom. Front desk - very helpful in giving directions and recommendations. Loved the street life around, it is what gives the area such a vibrant atmosphere. Plus we saw the Jose Carreras concert on the Steps. What a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: Visitor294265
Reviews.Content: We asked for and was given a family room that could sleep 4 . It was good sized, comfortable and clean and good value. It even had an extra toilet and a small balcony (though not much view). Best part - great location, near good tourist venues, eats, shops, etc. Service overall was good and we had no particular complaints. Parts that can be better - the bed was too hard. There is free wifi and that works fine at the hotel reception area. However, the internet connection at the Condotti Palace aparthotel was so poor, it is as good as none. Overall - its a hotel we would use again and would recommend to others too.

Reviews.Title: “location trumps all the quibbles”
Reviews.Author: foodsearcher_9
Reviews.Content: pro gracious and helpful staff great place to stay - nice to walk around and a good number of good eateries nearby con king size bed took up almost entire room you need to walk a block to get to the hotel desk and breakfast crowded for breakfast but I'd stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Probably better options in the area”
Reviews.Author: Stonefly6
Reviews.Content: Staff not friendly or willing to assist with requests. Roach in bathroom. 3 channels on antenna tv. No iron, safety concerns. Bed was solid as a rock. Good location but would rather nicer hotel in another location.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, SAFE LOCATION with CLEAN, MODERN Room”
Reviews.Author: rwidger
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with wife and 2 little girls so I looked mostly for reviews that meantioned a safe location. We were pleasantly surprised that our room was very big ( 2 rooms actually), modern, clean, great bathroom and shower... and when you walk out the door, even at midnight, the streets are filled with nice pizzerias and friendly safe foot traffic. You can walk from this spot to anywhere in touristy Rome within 20-30 minutes. For example, our first day we walked straight to the Colloseum in 20 minutes, even with 8 & 9 year old girls. The neighborhood around the hotel is filled with fancy shopping, and great food. This was not the most expensive hotel I found online, but also not the cheapest. But it turned out to be very easy to recommend. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Location is very good. Everything else is average.”
Reviews.Author: inezLiem
Reviews.Content: The location of Condotti Palace is very strategic. It is very near to all the shopping, restaurants, underground Metro, Mc.Donald, and the Spanish Steps. Everything else is average. The room is a bit small. But I would still recommend Condotti Palace to my friends because of the locations. Very central.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but poor managment”
Reviews.Author: fanouli
Reviews.Content: As everyone said before the hotel has a great location, near Spanish Steps and the commercial area of Rome. The problem we encountered is that although we made through internet a reservation at this hotel, the room we booked was not available when we arrived and they put us at a much smaller room at another hotel next to Condotti palace (Condotti Hotel). The two hotels are very different and the room at Condotti hotel was very small (we were four persons and had booked a family room) and very old-fashioned. The problem is that apart from not informing us in advance for this problem, the receptionist tried to make us thing that the room at Condotti Hotel is an upgrade! After a long argument the two of us went to a double room at Condotti Palace and the next day we all got transfered to the room we had booked in the first place, which was much better, with modern furniture, two spaces and much bigger! I could understand that there had been a mistake but in that case the hotel should try to do its best to please us and not try to mislead us into believing that the room at Condotti Hotel was better than the one we had booked. In similar cases the hotel usually offers something for the discomfort, like free breakfast, but that was not the case here. I think that they didn't manage the situation correctly. Apart from this the room at Condotti Palace was very nice with modern furniture and seemed recently renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Worlde-traveller
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great central location. Thats is alas - expensive for what you get. Room 107 was only slightly larger than the bed in it, no bath. Room above was noisy all night, seems no carpets on wooden floor above! Also, told no possibliity of later check-out, had to be out by 11h30! Also, name slgihtly misleading - it is on on Via Condotti, but 2 blocks away. Having walked the area can suggest many better, and seemingly cheaper places (all 5* to boot). For example try Hotel de Russie, Hotel Plaza, Hotel Hassler de Medici (top of Spanish Steps). Personally think hotel has cleverly marketed itself through Travel Agents expecially.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NorwayBear
Reviews.Content: A cosy, newly renovated, hotell close to everything in Rome. The familyroom we had was perfect for two adults and two children, with a separate bedroom. The personell was friendly and welcomming and took care of all our needs. The location can not get any better in Rome!!! THe hotell is pretty expensive but I guess with this location you cant get anything much cheaper. Overall we had a very good stay at the Condotti Palace.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient place to stay downtown that is good value”
Reviews.Author: cooxie3
Reviews.Content: Can't find fault with the place. It's friendly, clean and very well located. Our room was smallish but very adequate. The fridge was useful for keeping snacks, once we stored the minibar's contents elsewhere. The staff are very helpful & informed. It would help to know in advance that registration is around the corner, not at the address listed on the net.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent staff, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: eileenf19
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the strength of Trip Advisor reviews and it did not disappoint. The staff were very pleasant, the room was very clean and it is in an excellent location. We have recommended the Condotti to friends who are planning a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location staff very nice and hotel great”
Reviews.Author: busuttil80
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to this hotel and we will be going back in October great staff and location is perfect rooms are good and breakfast ok

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PAIM
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time staying with Condotti Hotels group. First time we were in the main hotel, last time at the annex and this time in the Condotti Palace. Every time has been good. Each time we have had breakfast at the Condotti Hotel. The breakfast room is quite small therefore don't expect an extensive buffet but what is provided is perfectly adequate. Because of its location, guests should expect a certain amount of noise in the rooms if at the front. The rooms are a good standard for this class of hotel and some are actually quite large for a Rome hotel. We recommend the Condotti Palace and will definitely stay with the Condotti Hotels group when next in Rome. Several of our friends are already booked to go there on our recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location 2 mins stroll from spanish steps”
Reviews.Author: jess186342
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. There was a problem with one of the rooms which was immediately rectified. All reception staff speak excellent english and very helpful. Avoid room at top if you are tall. Looking forward to coming back soon

Reviews.Title: “Good compromise of value and great location”
Reviews.Author: guinnw
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in Rome, near the Spanish Steps. It was easy to get to many things of interest. The staff was very helpful. My only complaint is that breakfast was not included in my rate. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “location is great”
Reviews.Author: freeload18
Reviews.Content: good experience. However, room a little bit noisy outside, even with closed windows. Noisy between rooms.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mparmpatina
Reviews.Content: In a perfect location, with very kind and helpful staff our stay was enjoyable. if we will visit Rome again we will stay with a great pleasure. Everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Rome201019
Reviews.Content: Vladimir, front desk manager anbd staff are very friendly ! The rooms very clean, comfortable, big and cosy, nice interior. Hotel is located in the centre of Rome near to the Spaniss Steps and the rooms are very quiet. The price for the rooms are fair. We booked this hotel because of the good rating at tripadvisor - we were very satisfied and we will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Value with Small Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Aristoseimi
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay at the Condotti Palace again -- the rooms were small but clean, and we had a patio area. The best part is that the hotel is a block away from the famous Piazza di Spagna, right in the heart of everything you want to see in Rome. This hotel is very basic, but perfect for people who want a home base and a good value (€83 a night!). The Condotti Palace does not have a lobby of its own, but is affiliated with the Hotel Condotti around the corner which hosts its reception. I only have three small criticisms of the hotel: 1.) the drain in the shower didn't work very well, which had me standing in an inch of water every morning... from the previous bather; 2.) the linens were a little ratty' 3.) we were required to leave our keys at the front desk (around the corner) every time we went outside. Generally, this wasn't a problem (only slightly annoying and felt like mommy and daddy were keeping tabs), but one of the front desk attendants was a little smarmy about returning the keys. All in all, I would stay at the Condotti Palace again, and would recommend it for other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dragnet98
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in the apartment annex. Location is excellent. Food is just downstairs and always available whether for breakfast or late dinner after a long day of visit to other parts of Rome. The wife will be pleased that shopping is also just at the doorstep. Taxi stand is just round the corner. Room is a tad smallish but enough to put 4 of us comfortably with 3 large suitcases. Some issues with the heater on first night but was fixed quickly by helpful front desk. Some steps to climb so be prepared to lug up and down your luggages. However, the hotel do have someone to help you to carry them so do request for their help. Overall, will stay here again if we are ever back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: degtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the annex, there was some noise late at night because of a terrace of a bar in the (pedestrian) street. Apart from that, perfect location, not expensive and decent breakfast. Will be back shortly!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: pullicinos
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. Excellent location. People at front desk very polite and very helpful. Rooms a bit small , but very clean. Hotel has a lot of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value”
Reviews.Author: UFPA10
Reviews.Content: Will stay here again. Great location close to the Spanish Steps metro and easy to navigate the city from here. The rooms were clean and appropriately priced so you could spend your money on more fun things!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great service”
Reviews.Author: brian5577
Reviews.Content: The Condotti Palace is perfectly situated near many of the major tourist attractions and offers excellent service and value for money. The staff at the front desk were awesome. They did everything they could to help and their command of English was superb. Definitely a hotel I will stay in when in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yoyo37
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in Hotel Condotti. The location was excellent. Room was a bit small but not the smallest we've stayed at throughout our trip, and you are in the center of rome where all actions are, so I'd say the room size was actually very reasonable. Staffs were very helpful and friendly. The only downside was the breakfast, selection wasn't huge and they often ran out of bread. In any case I'd give this hotel a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: aelane
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome and really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Condotti. We stayed in the aparthotel which is just around the corner from the main hotel. It was a great set up with a large bedroom (by European standards) and a separate sitting room with a single bed. Plus...there was an extra half bath which makes early mornings much easier. The room was clean and comfortable (beds a little hard) and the service from hotel staff was great. You cannot beat the location. We were able to walk everywhere and then easily leave the city via the metro stop less than 200 yds from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: DONNASTA11
Reviews.Content: We had a great Anniversary trip to Rome and the hotel Condotti Palace which came highly recommended to us by some friends and we can now see why. The hotel is perfectly situated with everything being easy to get to. The hotel itself was smart and elegant with great, stylish and marvelously comfy rooms (a great place to retreat to after a hectic days shopping). The staff couldn't have been nicer, and Romolo, on the front desk, really knew his stuff. He recommended some fantastic places to eat, along with some great tips for getting the most out of the city. Our trip went by too fast and we were sad to leave, but are already planning our return to Rome and the Condotti Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Noorasikin
Reviews.Content: I tremendously enjoyed my 4 nights stay at Condotti Palace. Its conveniently located for shopping and sightseeing. Just a few steps away to Spanish steps and its metro. We were given a room on the 4th floor with a cute balcony overlooking the busy alley lined with shops and restaurants. No need to drag our luggage (as we did in Venice) as every floor is served with an elevator. The best of all, are the service provided by all the staff at Condotti Hotel. If I ever come to Rome again in near future, I will not hesitate to stay here again. Thank you Condotti. Salam from Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cvdaou
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay in Rome. Great Value for money. 2 minutes from the Spanish steps and from the Via Condotti, Via Borgognona, and major well known brands: Bulgari, Gucci, Armani, Dior, Sergio Rossi, Testoni, Dolce & Gabbana... Very clean rooms, and very nice team at the hotel. Speaks fluent English. You can choose to stay in a 5 star hotel in Rome far from the center or stay at condotti palace and with the price difference spoil yourself with something from the great shops around you. In my next trip to Rome I will definitely stay there. Had a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarshallRome
Reviews.Content: Excellent help at front desk, clean quiet room, great deal on price. Fantastic location a couple of blocks from Spanish Steps and we walked all over Rome during our stay. Would stay there again if we got great rates again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service. We were very pleased with Condotti Palace.”
Reviews.Author: camp_40Toronto
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is very close to the Spanish Steps and a taxi stand. Front desk and bell staff are very friendly, helpful, efficient and speak English well. Our room was in the building just outside and around the corner from where the hotel lobby/main desk was located but this was not an issue. We felt very secure and staff were readily available to assist with any request we had. Our room was very clean, modern and had all necessary amenities. The lift was as large as any that we saw during our travels in Europe. We would stay at Condotti Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Desiré
Reviews.Content: Being right near the Spanish Steps, Metro and the Villa Borghese carpark was very convenient. It was a little strange having to enter the Condotti Palace section of accomodation from a normal little single entry door on the next street around the corner from reception. Once you were in your room though, they were very fresh and modern with everything lovely and new. Being requested to leave your room key with reception, when reception wasn't as you were leaving the building was a small nuisance - especially when you just wanted to run back up to use the toilet. The internet connection was very dodgy. Overall though, it was a great place and the people on reception were always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location was excellent and good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: 255068Sandy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is only a short metro ride from the main train station in Rome then a short walk. Very central to all major sightseeing attractions. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome stay at Condotti Palace”
Reviews.Author: hromios
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room that accommodated two adults and two children (12yrs and 14yrs). The room was absolutely divine. My husband and I had our own room and the children were in the lounge area where the sofa opened up into two separate single beds. Our rooms were serviced everyday. The location of this hotel is ideal. We walked everywhere! Including the colosseum and the Vatican. Restaurants, delis and cafes are all located in the same street and surrounding streets. Shopping was close by as well. The children were thrilled with the free wifi available ( you would need to get a card from reception - at Condotti Hotel) I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Tracy035
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic. Everything was on the doorstep. I thought it was the nicest location in Rome. Didn't really see any staff, which is the way we like it. We only saw them to check in and out, but they were pleasant. The room was small and basic, but very clean.However, we hardly spent anytime in the room as too much to do & see. We also had clean towels every day. We had a balcony which was a nice surprise, and very quiet as we were on the back.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING & PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Michkie43
Reviews.Content: I had to write this review so that others know that this hotel is ideal for your visit to Rome. Both the main hotel and annex are a block from the Spanish Steps (which also has a taxi stand) and the streets are filled with great restaurants. Being that there were 4 of us girls - we got the family room which worked well even with the 1.5 baths. I'd recommend a different set up with 2 couples just because the 1 full bath may be an inconvenience. The street 'changes' from the weekend to the week day as some shops/restaurants aren't open 7 days a week. I would highly recommend Otello's which is located directly across from the annex entrance. It's a great trattoria and has the most amazing food! The staff at the hotel were more than accommodating, friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for seeing sights”
Reviews.Author: gypsyontour
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Condotti Palace in August, it was a very nice hotel and centrally located. The price for this hotel can vary significantly; the one night I stayed I would say excellent value but then I came back and wanted to stay two nights and they almost doubled the price. Clearly the price went up because they were full but at the full price there are many areas I prefer to stay. I prefer staying in Trastevere or Campo de Fiori because of the nightlife but if your not into going out, then this area is perfect there are lots of touristy restaurants and great shopping. All the main tourist attractions are very close by. Air conditioning was great and the shower was fantastic. If you can ask for one of the rooms with an outside terrace great place to enjoy a glass of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of elevator problems”
Reviews.Author: ComeBackToSorrento2
Reviews.Content: The best part is the location. Would be willing to look past any minuses if it weren't for the elevator problems. The elevator got stuck between floors with us in it. Apparently the buzzer in the annex is not connected to the main part of the hotel where the lobby is located. Either that or the staff ignored us. We finally pried open one of the doors. When I told the staff what happened, they were quite nonchalant about it. The elevator was repaired, but broke again less than a day later. I heard from another guest that he had been stuck for half an hour before another guest helped him get the door open. Given how the staff acted, I'm led to believe that either the elevators are constantly broken or they don't care if their guests get stuck. The elevator in the main part of the hotel was broken the entire time we were there. I saw someone checking in with her 85 year- old mother trying to figure out how to get her up to the 3rd floor. I loved the location, but think I'll try elsewhere next time. Make sure that you and your family can climb the stairs if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “best location - loved it”
Reviews.Author: TheBrauns
Reviews.Content: we had two twins plus a full size pullout sofa, the two twins converted to queen. the room was clean, with air cond., had a fridge, a little safe where we were able to lock up our passports, fresh towels everyday, our beds were made every day, etc...best part: location, one block away from a small groceries store (we got our son's milk, my husbands beer, and good italian wine - you will appreciate this when restaurants and little stands sell you small sodas for 4 euros each) one block away from the Spanish steps (we were there every night just talking about what we did/see that day) fantastic atmosphere...two blocks away from the metro, three blocks away from a big McDonalds - we avoid it for the most part. I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, comfort, fair cost”
Reviews.Author: JES006
Reviews.Content: Great neighborhood near Spanish Steps and boutiques and loaded with restaurants. All streets are filled with tables and cafes or shops so there is no worry about eating in hotel. We did not eat one meal in hotel. We were there to be out and about as tourists. The A/C was fabulous and the temps were 35-40C; it was melting us down to skin and bones. The lobby is quite nice and cool with professional yet distant attitude from desk staff; not anyway uncomfortable or rude or bad, but it did not cross into friendly as we Americans are used to. The room was a good and average size with all systems working fine. The elevator did break down one evening so we trekked up 3 floors; we reported it and it was fixed later on.. Hallways were very tight and the noise was louder than I like. Strange layout inside the building where one goes up and down steps to get to elevator or other part of the hallway. Clean everything, esp. the bathroom. Good sized bathroom also. Funky part was the lobby was on one street, making a very nice impression but the 3 of 4 properties were around other streets in the neighborhood so you walked to your building to enter a plain steel door with no feel of a hotel there. Def had a feel of an apartment but it is very unusual for a hotel. I did sleep well and the shower was great and my trip was good. Just know that this is set up different than most hotels. Condotti Palace covers the basic very well but it is not luxury, unless the other hotels in the chain offer it, this one is good for tourists but would rather not go on business for the awkward layout.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, walking distance from popular Rome attractions.”
Reviews.Author: jbuckner56
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. We stayed in a triple room. It was very spacious and clean. The staff was hot and cold. The entire time we were there the elevator was broken. We had to climb a winding staircase 3 flights to get to our room. Skip the breakfast there, it is a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: wanderleygeraldo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well located , in the centre of almost all touristics sites and very near of Piazza de Spagna metro station . The staff is very kind and helpful, everyone in front desk speaking english. the room is quite small for a family besides two separated spaces. two restrooms but only one bathroom . all we need inside .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for my first trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Katiezac
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful we opened our window to the historic streets of Rome with shops and restaurants below us. It is close to all the major attractions. The room was modern and clean. Nice find in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: savvi10
Reviews.Content: The Condotti Palace Deluxe Apart hotel was great!! The room was very clean and nicely decorated. The staff (the reception is in Condotti Hotel) was really friendly and helpful everytime. Its location was ideal for sightseeing and shopping. Many good restaurants were in the area and Piazza di Spagna is only 50m away! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location, Modern, Updated with Historic Charm”
Reviews.Author: mcb356
Reviews.Content: Visited this aparthotel with a large family group including teenagers, young children and elderly. It was very, very nice. Located right near the Spanish Steps, and Metro station. Easy walking distance to Trevi Fountain and Piazza Popolo and tons of shopping. The hotel was nicely updated and included a wonderful top floor garden room. We were happy to see a nice elavator. Can't say enough nice things about this hotel. Front desk staff, located around the corner at the Condotti Hotel will help arrange taxi's or tours as needed. Family suites were large and comfortable. Free WiFi was a major plus as well.

Reviews.Title: “A splendid experience for our first trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: mariejennysteph
Reviews.Content: We made a fabulous choice by staying at Condotti Palace in Rome. It is part of Condotti Group Hotels. My teenagers loved it. Spectacular location around corner from Spanish Steps. Also had a subway/metro station around corner for very easy access which worked out wonderfully for us. The rooms at hotel were very roomy and bathroom was quite large. Looking out window at cobbletstone street below with cafes was a treat. The gentlemen at front desk, Romolo and Vladimir, were incredibly helpful in arranging our transportation from the airport and to the port where we left for a cruise. The Condotti Palace is just a few short steps around corner from the main Hotel, but we had so much fun bringing suitcases over and up the little elevator. I would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Condotti Palace 'ok'”
Reviews.Author: sfspencer
Reviews.Content: Location was great. Just a stones throw from the Spanish Steps and within walking distance of all attractions (even with 6 yr old). Disappointed by room NOT living up to pics on website. NB to hotel: with advent of cyberspace imaging please 'manage expectation'! Room was small and dark with v little natural light and none in bedroom (had to sleep with bathroom light on so husband didnt suffer from clostrophobia). Staff were helpful and pleasant and lobby was plush. could have done with better channels on tv (only 1 english speaking). Hotel was ok and would recommend to friend but with warnings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ScottD15
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and the staff are so helpful that we will be back. Could they update the place a bit, sure but the possitives of location and value and service far outweigh any negatives

Reviews.Title: “Good find”
Reviews.Author: TexasCouple_24
Reviews.Content: Took Taxi to hotel from Train station, so no problems gettting there. Great location close to the Spanish steps. Staff was great and very helpful. Our room was nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel in excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: toni2916
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short trip in Rome, we booked the Condotti Hotel on a friend's advice. We would absolutely recommend this hotel for any traveller that seeks a central location, a top quality hotel at a very reasonable price. The hotel is situated close to the Spanish Steps with shops, restaurants and transport at the doorstep. Our room was spotlessly clean and bigger than I expected for an Italian hotel. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly, thanks to Romolo for his courtesy and advice! Will definetly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: InCLE01
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to Italy. We booked a suite for Sat thur Monday, but we arrived a day earlier. They fortunatley had our room for us. Since it was still available late in the day, I believe they could have honored our lower room rate. There were four of us and they let us chose between 2 rooms. One a larger room with bath and the suite we requested. We chose the suite because it had 2 separate rooms with a bath and a half. This was a great advantage when trying to get ready in the morning. The hotel door is around the corner from the lobby of the hotel Condotti and is located on Via de Croce. We found the room to be satisfatory. Would advise addiing a shower curtain to avoid the puddles on the floor and less maintanance in the future. The small bathroom had a musty odor but it appeared clean. There was a TV in both rooms but we would have liked at least one English speaking chanel. Especially CNN or BBC. We did like the minibar refrigerator to store our snacks. The hotel staff was very helpful. Free access to the computer and internet was a big plus.. We apprectiated the umbrella they let us borrow. Capuccino and tea across the street was excellent. Location was perfect as you can walk to the Spanish Steps and most sites. The Metro is steps away. A little grocery store is located at the end of a side street about one small block away. This is a safe area with shops and plenty of dining choices. Over all I would reccomend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a Palace”
Reviews.Author: cees81
Reviews.Content: I've heard many horror stories of people traveling to Rome with horrible hotel rooms and I must say, I am glad to have found Condotti Palace. We stayed in this spacious aparthotel and not only was it beautifully furnished and modern but it was also very clean every day. The staff, particularly Paula, was very helpful and attentive. To add to this, the location of this hotel is literally in the heart of Rome. It is close to many near by shops of all price ranges and is surrounded by dozens of places to eat. It is conveniently located close to a taxi stand and to the metro station. The best part of all is that it is only steps away from Piazza de Spagna - The Spanish Steps- one of Rome's most popular places to be. It is also not a far walk to Fontana de Trevi- The Trevi Fountain. Don't forget to throw a coin in the fountain with the wish of returning to Rome one day. Because when I do revisit Rome, i will definitely be staying there again. And trust that if you decide to stay at Condotti Palace, it will be a pleasant and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and apartment for considerable cost”
Reviews.Author: alexus80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this aparthotel for the second time. (first we were there in February 2008) for 3 nights just for 260 Euro (special offer). It has a qualified stuff, exellent location and modern furnished rooms of normal size, aproximately 16 sq.m .(20 total). We had breakfast outside the hotel in the nearby restaurant just for 4 euro for tea, coffee and 2 cruassants. Registration and checkuot are exellent (no credit card freezing or deposits, just making a slip). All personnel speaks English, and very helpful to the guests. Wi-fi Internet works well and free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dalewynter85
Reviews.Content: After the airline lost our bags 'nightmare' all we wanted to was get to our hotel, luckily this hotel is a stones throw from spanga station although when you get there make sure you Check In At Via Mario De Fiori 37 not 15 Via Della Croce the address where the rooms are!!! when we arrived staff were very helpful in terms of helping us contact the airline to locate and arrange the delivery of our luggage and also recommending a lovely non touristy pizzeria to go too... the room was nice with a huge bed and a private terrace out back which would be amazing in the summer months... I WILL be returning to Rome and would love to stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “don't confuse with condotti hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizzysher
Reviews.Content: The Condotti Hotel and Condotti PALACE are two different B&B which are operated by the same people but are vastly different places and expreriences in terms of room quality. The Hotel is like the pictures you may see on the sites that look beautiful. The infamous Palace is what they call their "annex". I booked at the Hotel but for some reason was bumped to the annex upon arrival. Beware, I've read about this happening to others. The annex or "Palace" has dark rooms, ugly gross dark blue wall to wall carpet (which is unusal for Italians to have carpet) and just very depressing.. Also, it was a bait and swtich since I had read the reviews and made sure that I had booked at the hotel Condottie not Condotti Palace. I did not want it to happen to me, but it did. They still set me up in the "annexI". I could have pitched a fit, but I was too tired and had arrived in the early evening from a long day of travel, plus the front desk guy was rather abrupt. I have to wonder if the previous good reviews were written by people who actually stayed at the Hotel and not the Palace. Be careful, you could be the next bait and switch! Al;so, breakfast at the annex is in a hallway standing up, not at the main hotel which looks nice in the pictures. I would not trust this place. I hope this post prompts them to make some changes!

Reviews.Title: “very clean and with a friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jackbay
Reviews.Content: we were very good hotel near the Spanish Steps and the Internet free and fast good restaurants in the street. good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: marzgr
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in the centre of Rome. Just behind the Spanish Steps. We were a party of 8, so we got to see 4 different rooms on the 3rd floor. The rooms are very very small. They were cleaned every day, fresh towels, shampoos etc (we stayed there for 6 days), but the sheets were not changed once and the blanket was very dirty. The bed and pillows were really bad, we couldn't sleep at all on the first night. There isn't a good view of the city and if you're put in one of the back rooms, there is no view at all (see photos). I would say that this hotel is o.k. for really young couples that really don't care much about comfort. We payed €75/night not including breakfast (that was an extra €10 per person). Rome has hundreds of cheap hotels, much cheaper than €75, the problem is that they are all old and run down and filthy. This hotel has been renovated, so it's in much better condition, but the thing is that I'm not 18 years old and this hotel just wasn't enough for me and my husband. If I had to go to Rome again, I would chose to stay just out of the city center where the hotels are much better and cheaper. I would not stay at this hotel again, but I would not go so far as to not recommend it to anyone else. By the way, the pictures in their sight are not exactly fake, but they don't show the real thing. Just a small tip, do not drink the running tap water and keep in mind that bottled water is very expensive (€1.50 for a small bottle at least!!)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ant_n_eva
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located just around the corner from The Spanish Steps and a few blocks away from the Trevi Fountain this is a great base for sightseeing and shopping. All of the luxury brands are represented on Via dei Condotti just around the corner and the more affordable shops of Via del Corso are a short walk away. We were also able to walk to the Colosseum (about 1/2 hour) from here. Plenty of places to eat and drink from early morning till late at night in this charming area. Clean, modern room and bathroom. Hotel bed was one of the largest and most comfortable we have slept in. Hotel staff were friendly and informative. We do hope to return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Very very good!”
Reviews.Author: Colocolchik
Reviews.Content: Everything is very good - service, rooms, location!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: dmb227
Reviews.Content: LOVED the Condotti Palace!! As far as we're concerned...this is the place to stay in Rome! The hotel is in a great location, just a few blocks from the Spanish Steps. You step outside and you're right in the middle of it all....shops, cafes, markets, etc. The hotel was super clean (which is a must) and all updated! They gave us a king size bed and the bathroom was fairly spacious compared to most Eurpoean hotels. The best feature of the room was the patio/porch. The room had double doors that opened up to a porch that has outdoor furniture where you can hang out....have your own happy hour or grab some food from the local market and eat outside! If was a great way to just relax, but not have to be inside your room. We stayed in Rome for a week and enjoyed every minute of the city, the sites, the food, and the hotel. We will definitely be staying at the Condotti Palace on our next trip to Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bill00517748
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, rooms are a little small but furnished nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugConnecticut
Reviews.Content: My daughter (age 22) and I spent 3 nights here while traveling in Italy. The location of the hotel was great as it was close to the Metro, shopping, nice restaurants etc. The area was safe and both of us felt very comfortable. We chose to stay in the Palace rather than the Hotel Condotti as the Palace has non-smoking rooms. Given that my daughter has asthma, this was a necessity. The room was small as was the bathroom but I do not regret the decision to stay there as the location made up for the size. Our days were packed with sight seeing so we really never spent much time in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Traveller Coming to Rome ,stay away from this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sonnegott
Reviews.Content: As no rooms were available in the Main Hotel, we were put in the so called "Palace" -Hotel around the corner. Tiny and dark rooms with a mini Mickey -Mouse -bathroom ,made you feel totally uncomfortable ...at a room rate of € 265,-- per night !!! The so-called breakfast - which was served outside the hotel in a bar -was a real joke . Fortunately we stayed only one night. In fact the whole area around the Spanish steps ( better : tourist -traps ) should be avoided ,unless you look for bad accommodation & food, at totally unreasonable prices . Therefore : Traveller , coming to Rome ,stay away from this Hotel & area

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: annjanettew
Reviews.Content: our travel agent recommended this hotel to us... we stayed in the town home suites one little block over from the front desk... and I struggled to find info before we left, but even on TA I was coming up with hotel Condotti and the palace (all owned by Condotti) but was having trouble finding town home suite info. so we were nervous.... we checked in at the front desk in the palace location, and he was so kind and informative. he had someone come and walk us to our room (around the corner) and help us with out bags. we opened the door to our room and it was AMAZING. It was large (by European standards). The bathroom was beautiful and functional: maybe small to some, but perfect for us. The bed was great. My absolute favorite part was the window. It opened to bring in the sounds of the Spanish steps and wonderful air. It had a beautiful view of the beautiful little street. We opened it every night and just stood and took it all in. the room, all in all, was perfect for us. Clean, larger than average, tastefully decorated, functional. The daily breakfast buffet was right in our hallway area so it was very easy. They had juice and pastries and cappuccino…. I found it to be perfect. And the location. It doesn’t get any better than this. We walked everywhere. Took the metro once. Its a bit of walking…. But we loved it. We saw so much and found great places along the way. The front desk offered us great ideas for dinner, wonderful suggestions… and everything was so close. This truly is the best location in Rome, in our opinion. We will certainly stay here again if we find ourselves in Rome. We loved it so much and can not say enough about it. It was exactly what I pictured in my head as my dream Rome hotel. Its not a high-rise, Americanized hotel…. Which is why I loved it. It was a true Rome experience and I felt like we got a great taste of the Roman way of life. sorry i dont have more pics to post!!!! wish i had taken some of the room and such. next time... ps... if you’re planning your trip.... do NOT go to Rome without visiting Giolitti. ask for directions from the front desk. we went there everyday. it is without question the BEST GELLATO IN ROME. You should not miss out!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for sightseeing in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vonnie36
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apart-hotel in Via della Croce (E225 per night deluxe double/E425 junior suite). Having read some nit-picking reviews asked for rooms on 4th floor and found rooms to be clean, comfortable and adequately sized. The front door was round the corner from the main reception but the hotel reception staff could not have been more helpful or friendly, we left our keys there all the time and therefore saw them regularly. Breakfast was in the cafe almost next door but such a short walk it really is no inconvenience and they serve a very nice pot of tea. The Condotti is an excellent base from which to explore Rome on foot. In the evening it is staggering distance to local restaurants if you’ve walked miles during the day (Otello opposite was good). Don’t miss the excellent wine bar Enotecantica (corner Via della Croce/Via Bocca di Leone) for the hospitable and friendly bar staff, pleasant ambiance and food is good there too. We recommend this hotel, it is in a great location as a base from which to explore the sights of Rome and there are so many fantastic sights to see any additional facilities would have been wasted on us. Jan & Yvonne

Reviews.Title: “Good location, and that's it”
Reviews.Author: igazic
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is really excellent, however, we literally had a room with NO windows. I guess there are some rooms with windows, but I really do not think that is to much to ask. Breakfirst is in nearby caffe, which is really 3 meters from hotel doors, but, besides coffee which is excellent, pretty boring, especially taking into account what kind of wonderfull food you can have in Rome. However, be not fooled, hotels in Rome, like in any other big city are not cheap nor much better, so if you are going for a weekend, due to location which is around the corner from Spanish steps and in the middle of shopping area, you won't be disappointed. I took this hotel although it DID NOT have good rating on tripadvisor, upon advice of my travel agent, and I now kind of regret it, although being in hotel is not such a big thing when you are in beautyful Rome

Reviews.Title: “A great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: sentinala
Reviews.Content: Had a great time with the extended family at the Condotti Palace Apartments, where we stayed four nights recently. We had one suite and two double rooms, all on the fourth [and top] floor. The fourth floor has a "Roof Garden" which is actually a large, covered and airconditioned enclosed terrace, equipped with seating sofas, coffe tables etc. My granchildren had a swell time in this "family room". The terrace is open to all guests, but as the number of rooms in the property is tiny we actually had it all to ourselves. Otherwise the rooms are decent [European] sized, modern and clean. The help from the front desk at the main hotel is prompt and friendly. It is highly recommended as an "almost luxury" retreat at the heart of "Shopping Land" in Rome. Two negatives: Access in the main entrance hallway is not not suitable for people with restricted mobility, and from our experience during a previous stay you shoud try to get the fourth floor because sound insulation from the room above yours in the lower floors is inadequate.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: zanoula
Reviews.Content: great, spacious room (junior suite), beautiful decoration, extra clean and spacious bathroom, perfect overall. situated in the heart of rome, great place to start romantic walks from. very good breakfast as well, at a very '' roman'' cafe! higly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: BYRON5477
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at palace; and on arrival they changed it to a small dumpy room around the corner. We refused to stay there. When we asked for a refund they refusedto give one. They said when you book a room at the condotti palace they can put you in any of there other hotels. We lost about three hundred dollars. SO BEWARE

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ola72
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff (English speaking); breakfast in room or in "Snack Bar" across the street; reception in different building; nice modern rooms; rooms were fairly clean. We booked via Venere, and paid €110 per night for a double room, which we found good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: US-Tripsters
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer- we generally stay at less expensive hotels, but my husband was in Rome for business and so we only paid for one of three nights in this hotel (~180 €/night). This hotel is located just one street off Piazza di Spagna and placed us in an ideal location to visit this beautiful city by foot. Condotti Palace is an extension of Hotel Condotti. You check in at Hotel Condotti, but Condotti Palace has a separate entrance located around the corner. Although the entrance of the Condotti Palace is humble our room was lovely and very big. I believe we were upgraded to a suite although we booked a double. We had 1 ½ baths, a living room with flat screen TV, sofa and small balcony (interior facing) and a bedroom. The décor was very attractive and modern with exposed beams in the ceiling. We found everything very clean although the rooms were not cleaned until late in the day. The only downside of the design of the hotel was that when someone walked above us with hard soled shoes it was very loud. Unfortunately a guest came in the middle of the night in high-heeled shoes and proceeded to walk around for at least 45 mins and made it impossible to sleep. (If you stay here you may want to request a room on the top floor.) Breakfast was included and could be ordered to the room or taken in the café across the street. We recommend the continental breakfast in the main hotel if you can arrange it. We preferred the food and the cappuccino. The service was good, especially the young male concierge who worked evenings. All in all we found this hotel to be very nice as long as you are not expecting a proper lobby and other amenities outside the hotel room. However, given the price, the facilities were average with the exception of the location (fabulous) and the size of the room (but was likely a suite).

Reviews.Title: “More Apartmrnt than Hotel”
Reviews.Author: navygoat
Reviews.Content: On a previous trip we had stayed at the Hotel Condotti, and had a charming experience. This time we booked at Condotti Palace, their new "ApartHotel" just around the corner. It was brand new (some construction touchup still in progress). If you are looking for an apartment --- then this is a good, clean, secure, execellently located apartment. But if you are looking for warmth, a helpful front-desk, and other hotel ammenities, then you would be better served at their regular hotel. Just depends what experience you are looking for --- quiet apartment or warm hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Condotti Palace
